original: Dahl, Carl Georg Valdemar, professor, Hjo, f. 17/6/75 i Ekshärad, Värml. 1., av Georg D. o. Marie Charlotte Svensson. G. 11 m. Else Törnmarck. Barn: Sven f. 12, Anne-Marie 15, Inga Helena 19. — Stud:ex. 93, fil. kand. 01, fil. hed:dr i Lund 37, prof. namn 40, stud. o. prakt, trädg :skötsel inom o. utom landet. Förest, f. Adelsnäs trädg :sk. 03-10, f. Alnarps trädg :sk. 10-40, avd:förest. f. trädg :avd. v. Alnarps lantbr:-, mejeri- o. trädg :inst. 33-40, förest, f. stat. trädg :försök 37-40. Kommruppdr. i und:visn:frågor m. m. rör. trädg:und:visn. o. försöks-verksamh. Skr.: Handledn. i besprutn. av fruktträd o. bärbuskar (13), Lista över fruktsorter lämpl f. olika delar av landet (13), Fruktodhng (17), Handledn, i beskärn. av fruktträd (20), Trädgårdens vårblommor (tills. m. Else Dahl 25), Om pomologier o. pomologer (26), Morphological Studies of Plum Flowers (35), Pomologi I-II (43), Bilommor o. grönt (tills. m. G. Ekman 43). RNO, RVO, LLA, LFS.
translated: Dahl, Carl Georg Valdemar, professor, born on June 17th, 1875 in Ekshärad, Värmland, Sweden, first child of Georg D. and Marie Charlotte Svensson. He married Else Törnmarck in 1911 and they had three children: Sven (born in 1912), Anne-Marie (born in 1915), and Inga Helena (born in 1919). He completed his secondary studies in 1893, earned a bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1901, received an honorary doctorate from Lund University in 1937, and was appointed as professor in 1940. He studied and practiced horticulture both in Sweden and abroad. He was the director of Adelsnäs Horticultural School from 1903 to 1910, director of Alnarp Horticultural School from 1910 to 1940, head of the horticulture department at Alnarp Agricultural, Dairy and Horticultural Institute from 1933 to 1940, and director of the national horticultural experiment station from 1937 to 1940. He served as a municipal representative for issues related to horticultural education and experimental activities. He wrote several publications on horticultural practices, including a guide for fruit tree and berry bush spraying, a list of fruit varieties suitable for different parts of the country, a guide to fruit tree pruning, and a book on spring flowers in gardens. Additionally, he conducted research on pomology and wrote extensively on the topic, including a two-volume work on pomology. He received several awards, including Royal Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, Linnéan Society of London's Linnean Medal, and the Royal Agriculture Academy's silver medal.
